chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Steve L Danczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 years probation conditions of probation fine/costs 1750.00, Blood Draw Money - to Sheriff  $23.45  forward $2000.00 bond to DOC,  Absolute Sobriety   No drug use without a valid prescription. Maintain compliance with treatment,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent  revoke dl 27 months plus 8 months,   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  IID 27 months   On any vehicle owned or operated effective 3-2-15.   Substance Abuse Treatment,  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.  8 months county jail with huber  credit TBD  "good time" .

Defendant Steve L Danczyk in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF pleads NC to CT#1 found guilty, court withholds sentence 3 years probation conditions of probation fine/costs 1750.00, Blood Draw Money - to Sheriff  $23.45  forward $2000.00 bond to DOC,  Absolute Sobriety   No drug use without a valid prescription. Maintain compliance with treatment,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent  revoke dl 27 months plus 8 months,   DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  IID 27 months   On any vehicle owned or operated effective 3-2-15.   Substance Abuse Treatment,  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations  Attend Victim Impact Panel, obtain a driver assessment and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.  8 months county jail with huber  credit TBD  "good time" .

Defendant Steve L Danczyk in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties close to agreement/resolution including newly filed matter 15CF01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 11:15 am.

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Daily Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to DAILY TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
